pages.text: This entry is of little interest to those who don't particularly care for playing in an ''overworld'' dimension.$(br2)But, if you're interested in exploring an overbearingly brown environment, figuring out how to actually get started there, or just visiting later on, this might be of help.

pages.name: Old Haven Portal
pages.text: The above portal can be found at the spawning island in the void dimension, and used to enter and leave Old Haven.

pages.title: Loose Flint & Sticks
pages.text: The first thing you'll want to do once inside is scavenge for Loose Flint and Sticks.
Next, you'll want to craft a makeshift Chisel to forgo using various tool stations.
Now that you have a Chisel, you can carve some rather primitive tool parts!
After you've done some heinous microcrafting, you can finally craft the first pickaxe, which you'll be putting to good use $(o)very/$ soon.

To get your first sapling, you'll need Livingroot. Livingroot can be 'blindly' located underground in clumps of Mossy Cobblestone, or pinpointed by ''Fairy Rings'' on the surface; flip the page to see an example picture of them.
When you find some, you can read through $(l:beginnings/garden_of_glass)$(2)the first entry/$ for some explanations.

pages.title: Fairy Ring
pages.text: Be advised that the Livingroot clumps located under these are located very deep down!

pages.title: About Water
pages.text: In Old Haven, water is almost non-existant. All of the rivers are dry, and the same applies to most of the oceans. However, water can still be found in the remains of Deep Oceans...$(br2)You'll have to find one to progress past $(l:beginnings/eggshells)Panning/$.
